clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary Intervention With Shop Model - SHOPUS
clinical_study.official_title: A Six Month Randomized Controlled Dietary Intervention Study of the New Nordic Diet vs Average Danish Diet in Adults (18-65y) Using the Shop Model for Optimal Dietary Adherence

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to investigate whether New Nordic Diet (NND) versus Average Danish Diet (ADD) in adults (18-65 y) with central obesity and components of the metabolic syndrome can improve body weight loss and risk markers of the metabolic syndrome, type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular diseases.

primary_outcome.description: Change in body weight from randomization to end of intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in components of the metabolic syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the number of components of the metabolic syndrome
Achievement of 5% weight loss from randomization to end of intervention

other_outcome.description: Diet specific changes in relative abundance of microbial bacteria

other_outcome.measure: Microbial composition and association with Body weight change
other_outcome.description: Diet specific change in body weight according to relative abundance of microbial bacteria
Diet specific molecular regulation in adipose and muscle tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- abdominal obesity
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 45, previous weight change

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Human Nutrition, University of Copenhagen
